title: Empathy Test
description: How high is your emotional intelligence (EQ)? Measure your empathy level!

questions.question: When a friend shares sad news, you:
Can you tell someone's mood just by their expression?
When someone near you is struggling:

choices.text: I quietly stay by their side

questions.question: How much are you affected by others' emotions?

choices.text: Very much, I absorb their feelings

questions.question: When you see an animal in pain:
During conflicts, do you try to understand the other side?

choices.text: It weighs on me for a while
Genuinely happy and proud of them

questions.question: Can you sense what someone needs without them saying it?
Do you enjoy deep, meaningful conversations?

choices.text: I'd rather not have long talks

questions.question: Can you intuitively tell when someone is lying?

results.title: Empathy Genius (Top EQ)
results.description: You have an extraordinary ability to deeply understand and connect with others' emotions. People feel truly understood around you and naturally open up. Your empathy is a remarkable gift!
results.advice: Protect yourself from absorbing too much emotional energy. Healthy boundaries are important.

results.title: High Empath (Above Average EQ)
results.description: You have above-average empathy! You understand others' feelings well and respond appropriately. You're likely the go-to person for emotional support among your friends.
results.advice: Consider developing your empathy further. You'd excel in counseling or helping professions!

results.title: Balanced Empathy (Average EQ)
results.description: You have a balanced level of empathy. You navigate well between logic and emotion, adapting flexibly to situations. Sometimes being a bit more emotionally present could help.
results.advice: Try listening with your heart before your head sometimes. It can deepen your relationships.

results.title: Logical Thinker (Developing EQ)
results.description: You tend to prioritize logic and reason over emotions. You're great at problem-solving but may find emotional exchanges challenging. Empathy can be developed with practice!
results.advice: When someone shares a problem, try responding to their feelings before offering solutions.
